title: Hong Kong Revolution Gp Team V's Strategy. V小隊流血革命攻略！

replies.msg:
Hong Kong Armed Revolution Group Team V's Strategy. V小隊流血革命攻略！Chapman Chen, HKBNews, reports
Summary: An self-proclaimed armed revolution group, Team V, announces its plan to escalate its militant action to a gory level before the November District Council Election & publicizes its military strategy in a long online Chinese article. "Our biggest problem is not the enemy learning our strategy but no one on the frontline knowing what they are doing." It argues that organization is needed to turn human & material resources into combat power, that less is more. "Don't get infatuated with number of people. The proper way to grow strong is to pragmatically organize comrades into small teams of 3 to 5 members. Battalions will be formed bottom-up from teams, and gradually divisions will be formed."

In terms of tactics, Team V suggests decisive engagement in localities, while in terms of strategy, it supports long-term urban defensive guerilla warfare. "The demerit of urban guerilla warfare lies in the lack of depth and the profusion of surveillance." The merits include topographical complexity, vulnerability of the city, easiness to ambush police, and impossibility to use high-impact weapons.

Regarding the use of physical force, it emphasizes precision. "You may not be able to destroy a whole team of dogs, but you can get rid of them one by one, right?" Concerning resources, it advocates feeding on the enemy's blood. "An outstanding attack will earn not only police chase but also donations by a number of people plus valiant volunteers." As for public support, "we got to show that we are a people's army able to protect the people."

As mentioned in our previous article about Team V's revolution theory, the group claims responsibility for the early October vandalism of pro-CCP enterprises and Molotov cocktail attacks. Concerning why an armed revolution is needed, it says Hongkongers have always waited in vain. "In 1997 we waited for China to become democratized. In 2014 we waited for the CCP to give us alms. Today we wait for the US military to help us." It warns that if Hongkongers fail to take up their arms and fight valiantly now, the younger generation will be wiped out soon.
